snippet: Hassan Nasrallah, the head of the Shiite militant movement in Lebanon, also wants the country to open its border to refugees to avoid further bloodshed.
abstract: Hassan Nasrallah, leader of Hezbollah, openly urges Lebanese government to take more active role in finding political solution to civil war in neighboring Syria and to open its border to refugees to avert further bloodshed.

byline.original: By HWAIDA SAAD, ANNE BARNARD and CHRISTINE HAUSER
byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad and Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Christine Hauser from New York.

lead_paragraph: Hassan Nasrallah, the head of the Shiite militant movement in Lebanon, also wants the country to open its border to refugees to avoid further bloodshed.

headline.seo: Hezbollah Chief Urges Lebanon to Ease Syria Crisis
headline.main: Hezbollah Chief Urges Lebanon to Help in Syrian Crisis
headline.print_headline: Hezbollah Chief Urges Lebanon to Help in Syrian Crisis

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
